title: LogType​
content: </> type LogType = "DEBUG" | "INFO" | "WARN" | "ERROR" | "CHAT" | "COMMAND" | "JOIN" | "LEAVE" | "KILL" | "DEATH" | "DAMAGE" | "PURCHASE" | string

title: Log​
content: </> type Log = { text: string, level: LogType, time: number, user: number? }

title: Logger​
content: </> type Logger = typeof(setmetatable({}:: { logs: {Log}, debug: boolean? },Logger))

title: userRoleAdd​
content: </> Auth.userRoleAdd( userId: number, role: Role ) → () Adds a role to a user if they don't already have it

title: userRoleRemove​
content: </> Auth.userRoleRemove( userId: number, role: Role ) → () Removes a role from a user if it exists

title: getRank​
content: </> Auth.getRank( userId: number, permission: string? ) → number Checks the maximum role rank of the user, if permission is given it will fetch the highest rank of the roles with that permission

title: hasCommandGroup​
content: </> Auth.hasCommandGroup( userId: number, group: string ) → boolean Checks if a user has access to a command group

title: hasPermission​
content: </> Auth.hasPermission( userId: number, permission: string ) → boolean Checks if a user has access to a permission

title: rankDiff​
content: </> Auth.rankDiff( userIdFrom: number, userIdTo: number, permission: string? ) → () Gets the difference of two users' ranks, with an optional permission parameter

content: </> Auth.shouldRequest( context: {[any]: any}, to: Player , ...: any ) → boolean Shorthand utility for potentially abusive commands to check if they should show a request dialog

title: Theme​
content: </> interface Theme { ClackAll: State<boolean> ClackEnabled: State<boolean> Transparency: State<number> Primary: State<Color3 > PrimaryText: State<Color3 > Secondary: State<Color3 > SecondaryText: State<Color3 > Muted: State<Color3 > MutedText: State<Color3 > Border: State<Color3 > BorderMuted: State<Color3 > Valid: State<Color3 > Invalid: State<Color3 > FontSize: State<number> Font: State<Font > FontMono: State<Font > FontHeavy: State<Font > FontBold: State<Font > FontSemiBold: State<Font > FontLight: State<Font > CornerRadius: State<UDim > CornerHalf: State<UDim > CornerDiameter: State<UDim > Padding: State<UDim > PaddingHalf: State<UDim > PaddingDouble: State<UDim > StrokeEnabled: State<boolean> NormalTween: State<TweenInfo > TransparencyClamped: State<number> ScrollMidImage: State<string> ScrollTopImage: State<string> ScrollBottomImage: State<string> } A directory of Flux state for UI components to use as theme variables

title: edit​
content: </> UI.edit( new: Instance | Dict<any>, definition: SpecialDefinition | GuiObject ) → () Inherits Flux.edit Parents children to the ._content variable of a UI component if one exists Numeric indicies are defined as children with GuiObject.LayoutOrder set to the index Allows UI.Hook to easily hook to default UI state or RBXScriptSignal aliases

title: Function​
content: </> type Function = (...any) → ...any A generic function type

title: List​
content: </> type List = {T} A generic list type

title: Set​
content: </> type Set = {[T]: boolean} A generic set type implemented as a table with boolean values

title: Dict​
content: </> type Dict = {[T]: any} Represents a dictionary-like table with keys of type T and values of any type.

title: State​
content: </> type State = { _update: (State<T>) → boolean, _dependencies: Set<State<T>>, _dependents: Set<State<T>>, _binds: { [T]: any, _cleanup: List<any> }, _hooks: Dict<Function>, _value: T, _stateful: boolean, _operation: List<any>?, _tweenInfo: TweenInfo? , set: ( self: State<T>, new: T, force: boolean?, noTween: boolean? ) → State<T>, get: (self: State<T>) → T, hook: ( self: State<T>, callback: Function ) → Function, Destroy: (self: State<T>) → (), bindToProperty: ( self: State<T>, instance: Instance , property: string ) → (), bindToAttribute: ( self: State<T>, instance: Instance , attribute: string ) → (), } Represents a reactive state object in the Flux system

title: Stateful<T>​
content: </> type Stateful<T> = T | State<T> A type for state or raw values

title: SpecialKey​
content: </> type SpecialKey = {type: "SpecialKey"} A type for state or raw values

content: </> type SpecialDefinition = {[number | string | SpecialKey]: unknown} Represents the definition used in Flux.new and Flux.edit

content: </> type Scope = {[any]=Scope | any}

content: </> Flux.isState(object: any) → boolean Checks if an object is a Flux state

title: peek​
content: </> Flux.peek(object: T) → T Gets the current value of a Flux state or returns the input if it's not a state

title: peekVariadic​
content: </> Flux.peekVariadic(...: any) → ...any Gets the current values of multiple Flux states or non-state inputs

title: edit​
content: </> Flux.edit( instance: Instance , definition: SpecialDefinition&Instance ) → Instance  Edits an existing Instance with Flux state bindings and other properties

title: new​
content: </> Flux.new(className: string) → Flux.edit Creates a new Instance with Flux state bindings and other properties

title: computeFrom​
content: </> Flux.computeFrom( computation: (...any) → T, ...: any ) → State<T> Creates a computed state based on other states or static values

title: compute​
content: </> Flux.compute(computation: (use: <U>(U | State<U>) → U?) → T) → State<T> Creates a computed state, passing a use function to access and bind other states

title: tween​
content: </> Flux.tween( tweenInfo: TweenInfo , state: State<T> ) → State<T> Applies TweenService tweens with Instance properties bound to the Flux state

title: state​
content: </> Flux.state( initialValue: T | State<T> | Instance , property: string? ) → State<T> Creates a new Flux state with an initial value

title: _addDependency​
content: </> Flux:_addDependency(dependency: State<T>) → () Adds a dependency to the current state

title: _removeDependency​
content: </> Flux:_removeDependency(dependency: State<T>) → () Removes a dependency from the current state

title: _update​
content: </> Flux:_update(noTween: boolean?) → () Updates the state and propagates changes to dependents

title: Destroy​
content: </> Flux:Destroy() → () Destroys the state, clearing all dependencies and bindings

title: hook​
content: </> Flux:hook(callback: Function) → Function Adds a hook callback function to be called when the state changes

title: get​
content: </> Flux:get() → any Gets the current value of the state

title: set​
content: </> Flux:set( new: T, forceUpdate: boolean?, noTween: boolean? ) → State<T> Sets a new value for the state and triggers an update

title: bindToProperty​
content: </> Flux:bindToProperty( instance: Instance , property: string ) → () Binds the state to a property of an Instance

title: bindToAttribute​
content: </> Flux:bindToAttribute( instance: Instance , attribute: string ) → () Binds the state to an attribute of an Instance
